title: A commander swapped sides in Sudan’s civil war. His community paid in blood.
description: Victims say the Rapid Support Forces have carried out a spree of killing, sexual assault and looting after Abu Aqla Keikel’s defection to the Sudanese military.
author: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun
excerpt: Victims say the Rapid Support Forces have carried out a spree of killing, sexual assault and looting after Abu Aqla Keikel’s defection to the Sudanese military.
text: The first harrowing accounts are trickling out about a series of punitive raids over the last week of October on villages in Sudan’s southern Gezira state, from survivors who had to trudge days through the scorching desert to reach help.A rights group reports women being gang-raped in front of their families, the shame driving some to suicide. Men who tried to protect them were shot, a witness tells The Washington Post. One villager describes terrified residents fleeing into fields that were later raked with gunfire — and seeing a woman who died giving birth while she fled, her newborn following soon after.
html:
The first harrowing accounts are trickling out about a series of punitive raids over the last week of October on villages in Sudan’s southern Gezira state, from survivors who had to trudge days through the scorching desert to reach help.

A rights group reports women being gang-raped in front of their families, the shame driving some to suicide. Men who tried to protect them were shot, a witness tells The Washington Post. One villager describes terrified residents fleeing into fields that were later raked with gunfire — and seeing a woman who died giving birth while she fled, her newborn following soon after.
